The electric potential at a distance \( r \) from a point charge \( Q \) is given by \( \varphi = \frac{kQ}{r} \). The electric field due to a point charge \( Q \) at a distance \( r \) is \( E = \frac{kQ}{r^2} \). The electric force on a charge \( q \) in an electric field \( E \) is \( F = qE \).
